title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 10
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey 

The General Classification stayed the same after a flat, sprint stage. Despite a small crash for Ineos and Jumbo Visma early on in the race and some echelons towards the end of the day, all the major yellow jersey contenders finished safely in the front peloton.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Ben O'Connor +2:01
3. Rigoberto Uran +5:18
4. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
5. Richard Carapaz +5:33
6. Enric Mas +5:47
7. Wilco Kelderman +5:58
8. Alexey Lutsenko +6:12
9. Guillaume Martin +7:02
10. David Gaudu +7:22

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Mark Cavendish leads the points classification for Deceuninck Quick-Step following his third stage win of this year's race. He didn't feature in the intermediate sprint of the day, as Sonny Colbrelli took third place behind the two breakaway riders. His win gave him enough points to further extend his lead, though.

1. Mark Cavendish - 218 points
2. Michael Matthews - 159 points
3. Sonny Colbrelli - 136 points
4. Jasper Philipsen - 133 points
5. Nacer Bouhanni - 117 points

The Tour de France jerseys – the race so far

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

The KOM classification stayed the same on today's stage. Hugo Houle of Astana-Premier Tech took the single point on offer on the only KOM of the day from the breakaway.

1. Nairo Quintana - 50 points
2. Michael Woods - 42 points
3. Wout Poels - 39 points
4. Ben O'Connor - 24 points
5. Sergio Higuita - 22 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

Similarly to the General Classification, the white jersey competition stayed the same after today's bunch finish.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
3. David Gaudu +7:22
4. Aurélien Paret-Peintre +11:54
5. Sergio Higuita +44:01

Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. AG2R Citroën +18:04
3. Ineos Grenadiers +27:33
4. Astana - Premier Tech +34:01
5. EF Education - Nippo +42:38

Cover image: A.S.O./Pauline Ballet
author: Peter Stuart
